revised_title: Dissecting Frequency-Curves into Normal Curves for Evolutionary Studies
tldr: The author discusses the dissection of frequency-curves into normal curves to better understand the mathematical theory of evolution. They explore various methods for breaking up abnormal frequency-curves and suggest that using the first five or six moments of the frequency-curve can lead to good results. The author also mentions the possibility of other methods leading to similar results, but has not yet discovered them.
